attributes.action: Birmingham city council are running the household waste and recycling service
attributes.additional_details: i would like the government to take over the running of Birmingham city council house hold waster and recycling the last year we have had strikes and now the weather stop them from collecting household rubbish and recycling for six weeks after ONE day of snow
attributes.background: would like the government to look into how the people of Birmingham are being hold to ransom by an out dated service run by Birmingham city council in waster and recycling

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.  

In any case the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Recycling is the responsibility of your local council. 

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: 

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors 

You can also petition your local council - you can find out more here: 

https://www.birmingham.gov.uk/info/20146/consultation_and_engagement/702/e-petitions
